title: (x) 18th Century handwriting - various {gang}
content:
Would anyone happen to know what the font used for the title of this book might be?   
   
Thanks so much for your help.   
   
 [http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0156012898/ref=lib\_rd\_ss\_TFCV/102-6364813-6447348?v=glance&s=books&vi=reader&img=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090557/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0156012898/ref=lib_rd_ss_TFCV/102-6364813-6447348?v=glance&s=books&vi=reader&img=1)#reader-link
author: anonymous

comments.content:
Yes, as long as it's not type.   
   
hhp

It is beautiful, isn't it!? I also think it was hand-lettered. However, P22 offers some very beautiful hand-y imitations such as [Dearest](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090557/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/dearest.html) or [La Danse](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090557/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/ladanse.html).
T26 also has some nice handwriting fonts especially by Frank Heine & Jim Marcus

Anglia Script at [PsyOps](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090557/http:/www.psyops.com/html/specimens.html) is quite beautiful, and the "Olde" style has the same rough line quality as your sample. And a little more daring (and absolutely free) are the delightful Selfish and Porcelain from [Eduardo Recife](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090557/http:/www.misprintedtype.com/) who has one of the finest collections of freeware grunge type I've come across.
Aw god, Eduardo had to shut down [misprintedtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100327090557/http:/www.misprintedtype.com/). Read his explanation and weep. Damn!
Yves, that Anglia script is yummy. I think I might even prefer that to Sloop. It seems a bit more calligraphic (by hand) as opposed to compugraphic (by computer)...

That's gorgeous handlettering; I really wish it were a font. But Anglia, Dearest, and Opsmarckt are absolutely beautiful and perfect for the eighteenth century mood, too. Thanks for all your excellent advice!
there are three i:s, two o:s, two e:s and two C:s in the title. none of them are the same. which strongly suggests that it is actually written by hand. which is good. calligraphy/handwriting rules.
